member.name: T:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.ActionsManager
member.summary: This system processes ActionPerformed components and uses MonitoringManager functions to build traces.

member.summary: As a singleton, this system can be accessed through this static instance.

member.summary: The contructor of this system.

member.summary: Function called when this started. All families are populated and can be parsed.

member.summary: Use to process your families.

member.name: T:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.Trace
member.summary: Data describing the trace built.

member.name: F:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.Trace.labels
member.summary: Labels found for this traced game action if in game analysis is enabled (see: MonitoringManager). return empty Array else

member.name: F:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.Trace.time
member.summary: Birth date of the trace.

member.name: F:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.Trace.componentMonitoring
member.summary: The ComponentMonitoring used to build this trace.

member.name: F:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.Trace.actionName
member.summary: Name of the traced action matching a transition in the Petri net of the ComponentMonitoring

member.name: F:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.Trace.performedBy
member.summary: Specify who performed this action, the player or the system.

member.name: F:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.Trace.orlabels
member.summary: links label concerned by this action. You can leave empty if only "*" operators are used in logic expression. Must be defined if logic expression associated to the action include "+" operators. For instance, if logic expression is "(l0+l1)*l3" you have to indicate which links to use to build the trace: l0 and l3 OR l1 and l3 => orLabels = new string[] {..., "l0", "l3"}; OR orLabels = new string[] {..., "l1", "l3"};

member.name: F:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.Trace.family
member.summary: The monitored Family to used to build trace. Null if the field ComponentMonitoring is filled.

member.summary: Parser of logic expressions.

member.summary: List of Petri Nets name

member.name: M:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.MonitoringManager.getMonitorById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get monitor with asked id.
member.param: The id of the monitor to get.
member.returns: The ComponentMonitoring object associated to the id if it exists. Return null otherwise.

member.name: M:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.MonitoringManager.trace(FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.ComponentMonitoring,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Trace game action.
member.param: The ComponentMonitoring to use to build trace.
Action name you want to trace, this name has to match with a transition defined into associated Petri Net of the "monitor" parameter .
Specify who perform this action, the player or the system.

Set to false if the logic expression associated to the action include "+" operators AND the action performed by the player is not allowed by the system. In this case fourth parameters will not be processed. True (default) means fourth parameter will be analysed.

links label concerned by this action. You can leave empty if only "*" operators are used in logic expression. Must be defined if logic expression associated to the action include "+" operators. For instance, if logic expression is "(l0+l1)*l3" you have to indicate which links to use to build the trace: l0 and l3 OR l1 and l3 => MonitoringManager.trace(..., "l0", "l3"); OR MonitoringManager.trace(..., "l1", "l3");
member.returns: labels found for this game action if in game analysis is enabled (see: MonitoringManager). return empty Array else

member.name: M:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.MonitoringManager.trace(FYFY.Family,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Trace game action.
member.param: The monitored Family to use to build trace.
Action name you want to trace, this name has to match with a transition defined into associated Petri Net of the "family" parameter .
Specify who perform this action, the player or the system.

Set to false if the logic expression associated to the action include "+" operators AND the action performed by the player is not allowed by the system. In this case fourth parameters will not be processed. True (default) means fourth parameter will be analysed.

links label concerned by this action. You can leave empty if only "*" operators are used in logic expression. Must be defined if logic expression associated to the action include "+" operators. For instance, if logic expression is "(l0+l1)*l3" you have to indicate which links to use to build the trace: l0 and l3 OR l1 and l3 => MonitoringManager.trace(..., "l0", "l3"); OR MonitoringManager.trace(..., "l1", "l3");
member.returns: labels found for this game action if in game analysis is enabled (see: MonitoringManager). return empty Array else

member.name: M:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.MonitoringManager.getNextActionsToReach(FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.ComponentMonitoring,System.String,System.Int32,System.String[])
member.summary: Get next actions to perform in order to reach targeted game action.
member.param: The ComponentMonitoring on which you want reach action.

Action name you want to reach, this name has to match with a transition defined into associated Petri Net of the "monitor" parameter . The special key word "##playerObjectives##" enable to target all player objective actions defined inside full Petri Net from which the monitor is part of (in this special case, "linksConcerned" parameter will be ignore).
Maximum number of actions returned.

links label concerned by this action. You can leave empty if only "*" operators are used in logic expression. Must be defined if logic expression associated to the action include "+" operators. For instance, if logic expression is "(l0+l1)*l3" you have to indicate which links to use to look for the trace: l0 and l3 OR l1 and l3 => MonitoringManager.getNextActionToReach(..., "l0", "l3"); OR MonitoringManager.getNextActionToReach(..., "l1", "l3");
member.returns: List of Pairs including a ComponentMonitoring and its associated game action useful to reach the targeted action, the number of actions returned is less or equal to maxActions parameters.

member.name: M:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.MonitoringManager.getNextActionsToReach(FYFY.Family,System.String,System.Int32,System.String[])
member.summary: Get next actions to perform in order to reach targeted game action.
member.param: The monitored Family on which you want reach action.

Action name you want to reach, this name has to match with a transition defined into associated Petri Net of the "family" parameter The special key word "##playerObjectives##" enable to target all player objective actions defined inside full Petri Net from which the monitor is part of (in this special case, "linksConcerned" parameter will be ignore).
Maximum number of actions returned.

links label concerned by this action. You can leave empty if only "*" operators are used in logic expression. Must be defined if logic expression associated to the action include "+" operators. For instance, if logic expression is "(l0+l1)*l3" you have to indicate which links to use to look for the trace: l0 and l3 OR l1 and l3 => MonitoringManager.getNextActionToReach(..., "l0", "l3"); OR MonitoringManager.getNextActionToReach(..., "l1", "l3");
member.returns: List of Pairs including a ComponentMonitoring and its associated game action useful to reach the targeted action, the number of actions returned is less or equal to maxActions parameters.

member.name: M:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.MonitoringManager.getNextActionsToReachPlayerObjective(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get next actions to perform in order to reach the player objective of the Petri net.
member.param: The Petri net name to process.
Maximum number of actions returned.
member.returns: List of Pairs including a ComponentMonitoring and its associated game action useful to reach the player objective, the number of actions returned is less or equal to maxActions parameters.

member.name: M:FYFY_plugins.Monitoring.MonitoringManager.getTriggerableActions
member.summary: Ask to Laalys to provide all triggerable actions
member.returns: List of Pairs including a ComponentMonitoring and its associated game action that may be triggered.
